author: madhavanmalolan
content:
I've been trying to learn more about governance and governance tokens & i have a question. 
Most other platforms like MakerDAO have a different token MKR for governance and a different token for the core utility Dai. Whereas Ethereum seems to be using ETH for both gas and staking (staking itself is a _form of governance_, right?). 

Can someone help me with understanding these decision tradeoffs? What can i start reading?

author: pietjepuk
content:
What is "most other platforms"? I'm not very familiar with the DeFi space, but RocketPool, Aave, Uniswap all seem to have a single token? I think it's more that Dai is a product of the DAO, just like exchanges/betting markets/etc are products of other DAOs.

As far as on-chain governance is concerned (and why Ethereum _doesn't_ do it), you can start here:
https://vitalik.ca/general/2017/12/17/voting.html
https://vitalik.ca/general/2018/03/28/plutocracy.html
https://vitalik.ca/general/2021/03/23/legitimacy.html

author: trent_vanepps
content: many token communities built on Ethereum and other Layer 1s (separate blockchains like Polkadot) have onchain governance that uses the native token to vote in governance. this is not something that Ethereum has or plans to have
